por.por_cntn:
The project was devoted to mathematical structures of Quantum Field Theory, studied recently by D. Gaiotto, G. Moore, E. Witten. Relevant mathematical structures include geometry of triangulations of planar polygons, homological algebra of categories, theory of constructible sheaves of categories. New definition of the so-called Fukaya-Seidel category was proposed. The idea is to consider the convex planar polygon spanned by the critical values of the Landau-Ginzburg potential and then associate to it the secondary polytope. The factorization structure of faces of the secondary polytope is reflected in the structure of higher Lie brackets on a graded vector space spanned by coherent triangulations of the polygon. This is a dual approach to the original idea of webs proposed by D. Gaiotto, G. Moore and E. Witten.  The above homotopy Lie algebra acts naturally on the Hochschild complex of the algebra generated by semi-infinite polygons (this depends on a choice of direction to infinity). The geometry of Kahler manifold is involved in the definition of the Maurer-Cartan element which deforms the above algebra.

The results of the proposal were reported at many international conferences. Several new collaborative research projects were started. The results of the project has already influenced some areas of mathematics and physics. Its continuation includes the new concept that any supersymmetric gauge theory gives rise to a perverse constructible sheaf of categories (perverse schober).
